title: News regarding ShipCo Logistics
story_body:
ShipCo Logistics Names New VP of Customer Experience

ShipCo Logistics (NYSE: SHIP) announced today that Maria Chen has been promoted to Vice President of Customer Experience, effective immediately. Chen, who previously served as Senior Director of Client Services, will report directly to Chief Operating Officer James Mitchell.

"Maria has consistently demonstrated strong leadership in enhancing our client relationships over the past five years," said Mitchell in a statement. "Her promotion reflects our ongoing commitment to delivering exceptional service to our customers."

Chen joined ShipCo in 2019 and has overseen the implementation of several customer feedback programs during her tenure. In her new role, she will be responsible for developing customer experience strategies across the company's North American operations.

The company also announced that several members of its executive team will attend the Global Logistics Summit in Atlanta next month. Chief Technology Officer Robert Park is scheduled to participate in a panel discussion on supply chain digitization trends.

Additionally, ShipCo unveiled its "Green Mile Initiative," a pilot program aimed at reducing fuel consumption in its last-mile delivery operations. The program, launching in select markets this quarter, will test route optimization software and explore partnerships with electric vehicle manufacturers.

"We're taking measured steps to improve our environmental footprint while maintaining operational efficiency," said Sarah Williams, ShipCo's Director of Sustainability. The company plans to evaluate the program's results before considering a wider rollout in 2025.

ShipCo has also launched a new marketing campaign titled "Delivery Done Right," featuring testimonials from long-term clients across various industries. The campaign will run across digital channels and trade publications through the end of the year.

The logistics provider, which operates a network of distribution centers across North America, reported revenues of $2.3 billion in its most recent fiscal year. The company employs approximately 12,000 people and serves clients in retail, manufacturing, and e-commerce sectors.

These announcements come as ShipCo continues to navigate a competitive logistics market while investing in technology and sustainability initiatives. The company is scheduled to report third-quarter earnings next month.
